application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Front Garden:T1:  Magnolia Grandiflora:Thin crown density by approximately 20%.  Reduce crown all round by approximately 1.00m.  Reduce roosting branches overhanging the main entrance gate by approximately 1.50-2.00m. Reasons:  Pigeons are using the tree for roosting and large amounts of droppings are causing the front gate and path to be unsanitary.  Our client has asked for a flying Falcon bird scarer to be installed to help abate further nuisance.T2:  Acer - (side of the building):Thin crown density by 20%.  Prune back to clear building by 1.50m.Reason:  General maintenance to control encroachment.T3:  Quince: Raise crown over the pavement by 0.50m.  Reduce back over the road by approximately 1.00m.Reason:  General maintenance to control encroachment on to the carriageway.
